newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Midcontinent unleaded dragged lower by NYMEX.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Midcontinent unleaded dragged lower by NYMEX.

text.p: U.S. Midcontinent unleaded gasoline and diesel fuel prices were dragged lower by falling NYMEX futures prices on Thursday, traders said.
Diesel differentials in Chicago and Group Three were largely steady against sagging front-month heating oil futures as a relatively mild winter melted away concerns about shortages in the Northeast.
Jet/kero basis also levelled off after climbing sharply higher over the past week on strong demand in the Midwest spot market, traders said.
Unleaded gasoline was bid 1.0 cent a gallon over NYMEX March unleaded in Group Three and 2.25 cents under the print in Chicago for prompt barrels.
Low sulphur diesel was bid 2.25 cents a gallon over NYMEX March heating oil in Group Three and 2.75 cents over the print in Chicago for prompt barrels, traders said.
Jet/kero firmed to bids 4.75 cents over the print in Group Three and remained 4.25 cents over in Chicago, traders said.
